required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Inhalation of Low Dose CO2 on Exercise Performance at High Altitude
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Supplement of CO2 Using Novel Portable Device on Exercise Performance at High Altitude

lead_sponsor.agency: State Key Laboratory of Respiratory Disease

clinical_study.source: State Key Laboratory of Respiratory Disease

brief_summary.textblock: High altitude (>2400 m) is associated with decreased atmosphere pressure leading to hypoxia which in turn impairs exercise capacity and causes acute mountain sickness (AMS). It is noted that adding CO2 might be beneficial to improve hypoxia and exercise performance at high altitude. However, no device is currently available that can supply a constant low dose of CO2 during free movement at high altitude. We have recently invented a portable device which is small and light enough for supplement of low dose CO2 during field exercise at high altitude.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objective: To determine whether the supplement of low-dose CO2 by the novel device could improve exercise performance at high altitude.
Methods: The lowlanders (<500m) who have no history of travelling to high altitude (>1000m) a year before the study will be recruited. And the subjects who are high-altitude residents and have not left high altitude over the last twelve months will also be recruited for the study. Subjects will be randomly and blindly given either CO2 mixed with air or air alone during endurance shuttle walking test (ESWT). Blood gases will be measured before and after inhalation of CO2. ESWT time, ventilation per minute (VE), blood oxygen saturation (SPO2), and end-tidal CO2 concentration (ETCO2) will be measured during exercise and will be compared during inhalation of CO2 and during inhalation of ambient air.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of the distance in walking test
primary_outcome.description: Changes in walking distance under inhalation of CO2 and ambient air

arm_group.description: Subjects will perform shuttle walk test under inhalation of low concentration of CO2 supplied by a novel device at high altitude.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Exercise under inhalation of ambient air
arm_group.description: Subjects will perform shuttle walk test under inhalation of ambient air at high altitude.

intervention.description: Participants perform shuttle walk test at high altitude while using the novel portable device for inhalation of CO2
Participants perform shuttle walk test at high altitude while inhaling ambient air
intervention.arm_group_label: Exercise under inhalation of ambient air

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy lowlanders (<500m) who have no history to travel to high altitude (>1000m) a year before the study.
2. Healthy high altitude (4500m) residents who have not left the inhabited area over the last twelve months before the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects with cardiovascular diseases, respiratory diseases and neuromuscular diseases which could affect exercise.

overall_official.affiliation: The Affiliated Hospital og Guangzhou Medical University

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: State Key Laboratory of Respiratory Disease

patient_data.ipd_description: The data will be shared after the paper of this study publishing.
